name: ARSENAL-SUMMONING GESTURE
prerequisites: Close Combat 2 or Ranged Combat 2 or Physique 2
description: The Exalt’s weapons and armor respond to her will, flying to her at her call. When the Exalt takes this Charm, choose whether it applies to weapons or armor. Spend 1 mote to summon your weapon or armor, or 2 motes to summon both. If the weapon or armor in question is within short range, Arsenal-Summoning Gesture is a reflexive action. If it is not, Arsenal-Summoning Gesture is a simple action. Spend 1 mote to banish your weapon or armor into Elsewhere, a non-space where your arsenal waits to be called upon as if it were in short range. Repurchase: This Charm applies to both weapons and armor.

modes.name: Dragon-Blooded
modes.title: Elemental Embodiment Expertise
modes.effect: A Dragon-Blood may dissolve her weapon in an embodiment of her aspect’s element. When she recalls the weapon, she may do so from any embodiment of her element within medium range, gaining a Power boost equal to her Essence.

modes.name: Liminal
modes.title: Implanted Weapon Mastery
modes.effect: The Liminal stores her weapons within her undead frame, violently disgorging them when needed. She may take a Health level of damage while activating this Charm to gain a Power boost equal to her Essence. This damage is waived if the Liminal is in Flesh Nature.

modes.name: Alchemical
modes.title: Integrated Armory Systems
modes.effect: Alchemicals can rapidly deploy weapons from hidden compartments, always treating Arsenal Summoning Gesture as a reflexive action.

name: DRAGON COIL TECHNIQUE
description: The Exalt’s mighty limbs hold her opponent fast. Spend 1 mote on Step 1. Double 9s on a withering attack to initiate a grapple, gain dominance in a grapple or take the attack action while grappling an opponent. In a successful grapple initiated by Dragon Coil Technique, a grappled opponent loses two dice on attempts to escape. Repurchase: The character may initiate grapples with a weapon, so long as it has the flexible, improvised, or pulling tags.

modes.name: Solar
modes.title: Crashing Wave Throw
modes.effect: When using the throw action (p.148), the Solar may spend Power to boost the damage dice.

modes.name: Lunar
modes.title: Foe-Hammer Technique
modes.effect: The Lunar may use the throw action to hurl a grappled target at another enemy within close range. When rolling damage dice, apply it against the Soak of both the thrown character and the target. Both characters take any damage rolled.

name: EXCELLENT STRIKE
description: The Exalt’s strikes find their mark regardless of any obstacles. Spend 1 mote on Step 3. Double the extra successes after applying Defense but before any bonus successes are applied. Additionally, ignore penalties hindering a single Close Combat attack, excluding self-imposed penalties and penalties that cannot be removed.

modes.name: Solar
modes.title: Impediment to Opportunity
modes.effect: Add any penalties ignored by this Charm as bonuses to the attack instead.

modes.name: Abyssal
modes.title: Blade of Misfortune
modes.effect: Add any penalties ignored by this Charm as bonuses to the attack instead.

modes.name: Sidereal
modes.title: Someone Else’s Destiny
modes.effect: If the attack is successful, the Sidereal may spend one additional mote to inflict any penalties she ignored through Excellent Strike on the target’s next action.

modes.name: Infernal
modes.title: Agony-Empowered Strike
modes.effect: If the Infernal waived a three-die penalty or greater, she gains it as a dice bonus to her damage.

modes.name: Liminal
modes.title: Shade-Reaping Spirit
modes.effect: Against undead foes, the Liminal treats ties against Defense as having a single success.

name: FISTS OF IRON TECHNIQUE
description: The Exalt throws punches like sledgehammers and kicks like mighty pistons. At the start of any combat scene, the Exalt may choose that his unarmed attacks count as medium or heavy weapons (p. 341), rather than light. Spend 1 mote on Step 1 to change this as a reflexive action. This does not count as the Exalt’s Charm on that step. When activating this Charm, also choose one universal or melee tag to apply to the Exalt’s unarmed attacks while Fists of Iron is active, excluding artifact. The tag does not change when the weapon classification changes. This may be used during a clash.

modes.name: Solar
modes.title: Adamantine Fists of Battle
modes.effect: Spend an additional mote on activation to grant the Exalt’s unarmed attacks the artifact tag.

modes.name: Lunar
modes.title: Claws of the Silver Moon
modes.effect: Spend an additional mote on activation to grant the Exalt’s unarmed attacks the artifact tag.

modes.name: Abyssal
modes.title: Writhing Blood Chain Technique
modes.effect: The Exalt’s unarmed attacks gain two additional universal or melee tags of your choice when the Charm is activated and can make attacks out to short range.

modes.name: Infernal
modes.title: Vicious Devil-Arms Technique
modes.effect: The Exalt’s unarmed attacks gain two additional universal or melee tags of your choice when the Charm is activated and can make attacks out to short range.

name: GUARD-BREAKING TECHNIQUE
description: Her blows send the enemy reeling. Spend 1 mote on Step 5. On a withering attack, reduce the target’s Defense by one until the start of their next turn. On a decisive attack, reduce the target’s Soak by one until the start of their next turn. If the target has Soak 6 or higher, instead halve the target’s Soak (round down). This Charm does not stack with itself.

modes.name: Solar
modes.title: Blinding Glare
modes.effect: The Solar catches light off her weapon, disorienting her foe. In addition to reducing the target’s Defense or Soak, also apply a one-success penalty to the target’s attacks until the end of their next turn.

modes.name: Alchemical
modes.title: Efficient Strike Calibration
modes.effect: Spend an additional mote on Step 7 to add two dice to the damage of a decisive attack.

modes.name: Lunar
modes.title: Foot-Trapping Counter
modes.effect: The target must remain in the same range band as the Lunar until the end of the Lunar’s next turn.

name: HEAVEN THUNDER HAMMER
description: The Exalt’s blows land with devastating force, sending her enemies flying. Spend 1 mote on Step 7 of a decisive Close Combat attack. At the end of the attack, the target is knocked back one range band and falls prone. If the attack inflicted three or more levels of damage, the target is knocked back two range bands instead. This may be used during a clash.

modes.name: Solar
modes.title: Sledgehammer Punch
modes.effect: This Charm can be used with a withering Close Combat attack, counting extra successes as damage for determining knockback.

modes.name: Abyssal
modes.title: Sledgehammer Punch
modes.effect: This Charm can be used with a withering Close Combat attack, counting extra successes as damage for determining knockback.

modes.name: Infernal
modes.title: Hot on Your Heels
modes.effect: The Infernal may spend one additional mote to appear at anywhere within close range of where the target lands.

modes.name: Liminal
modes.title: Banishing Fist
modes.effect: When used against an undead character, the target must use a miscellaneous action to make a difficulty 5 Force + Integrity roll to willingly approach the Liminal. This effect lasts for the rest of the scene.

name: MANY-ATTACKS TECHNIQUE
description: The Exalt blurs into action, attacking with a furious series of blows. Spend 2 motes on Step 1. After resolving a Close Combat attack, the character makes a second Close Combat attack against the same target or a different one. This attack is treated as though it were part of a flurry. The initial attack is not penalized.

modes.name: Solar
modes.title: Iron Whirlwind Attack
modes.effect: The second attack is made without a dice penalty.

modes.name: Abyssal
modes.title: Iron Whirlwind Attack
modes.effect: The second attack is made without a dice penalty.

modes.name: Infernal
modes.title: Violence Begets Violence
modes.effect: Reduce the flurry penalty to one die. If the first attack killed the target or reduced them to a new wound penalty, the second attack gains a one-success bonus.

modes.name: Lunar
modes.title: Octopus and Spider Barrage
modes.effect: The second attack may be substituted for any other Finesse-based combat action, instead.

modes.name: Sidereal
modes.title: Harmony of Blows
modes.effect: The Sidereal may trade extra successes on Step 5 of the first attack for bonus dice on the second.

modes.name: Strawmaiden Janest
modes.title: Busy Harvest
modes.effect: Janest’s mode functions as Solar mode.

name: SWIFT COUNTERATTACK
description: Reading her enemy’s movements, the Exalt unleashes a deadly counterattack. Spend 1 mote and 1 Power on Step 8. The character makes a Close Combat counterattack targeting one enemy who attacked her this round. She must be able to strike her target within the range of her weapon. This counts towards the action limit.

modes.name: Solar
modes.title: Ready in Eight Directions
modes.effect: The Exalt instead commits 1 mote until the end of the scene and may make additional counterattacks at the cost of 2 Power each. The additional attacks do not count toward the action limit.

modes.name: Abyssal
modes.title: Hundred Razor Circle
modes.effect: The Exalt instead commits 1 mote until the end of the scene and may make additional counterattacks at the cost of 2 Power each. The additional attacks do not count toward the action limit.

modes.name: Infernal
modes.title: Devilish Retribution
modes.effect: The Exalt instead commits 1 mote until the end of the scene and may make additional counterattacks at the cost of 2 Power each. The additional attacks do not count toward the action limit.

modes.name: Lunar
modes.title: Foe-Baiting Sidestep
modes.effect: As part of the counterattack, as long as the Lunar and her target are within the same range band, she switches places with him. Lower the target’s Hardness by one, as though he had been the subject of a withering attack.
